titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4768, SEPARATION OF POWERS RESTORATION ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4768, SEPARATION OF POWERS RESTORATION ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 107

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Separation of Powers Restoration Act of 2016_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 796, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4768) to amend title 5, United States Code, with respect to the judicial review of agency interpretations of statutory and regulatory provisions; providing for proceedings during the period from June 23, 2016, through July 4, 2016; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules, by a recorded vote of 230 ayes to 168 noes, Roll No. 344, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 232 yeas to 168 nays, Roll No. 343.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Separation of Powers Restoration Act of 2016_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 796, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4768) to amend title 5, United States Code, with respect to the judicial review of agency interpretations of statutory and regulatory provisions; providing for proceedings during the period from June 23, 2016, through July 4, 2016; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules, by a recorded vote of 230 ayes to 168 noes, Roll No. 344, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 232 yeas to 168 nays, Roll No. 343.

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1270, RESTORING ACCESS TO MEDICATION ACT OF 2015

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1270, RESTORING ACCESS TO MEDICATION ACT OF 2015; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 107

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Restoring Access to Medication Act_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 793, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1270) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the amendments made by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act which disqualify expenses for over-the-counter drugs under health savings accounts and health flexible spending arrangements, by a recorded vote of 226 ayes to 168 noes, Roll No. 346, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 168 nays, Roll No. 345.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Restoring Access to Medication Act_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 793, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1270) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the amendments made by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act which disqualify expenses for over-the-counter drugs under health savings accounts and health flexible spending arrangements, by a recorded vote of 226 ayes to 168 noes, Roll No. 346, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 168 nays, Roll No. 345.

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5485, FINANCIAL SERVICES AND GENERAL GOVERNMENT APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5485, FINANCIAL SERVICES AND GENERAL GOVERNMENT APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 107

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act, 2017_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 794, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5485) making appropriations for financial services and general government for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017, by a recorded vote of 227 ayes to 172 noes, Roll No. 348, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 229 yeas to 169 nays, Roll No. 347.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act, 2017_Rule for consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 794, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5485) making appropriations for financial services and general government for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017, by a recorded vote of 227 ayes to 172 noes, Roll No. 348, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 229 yeas to 169 nays, Roll No. 347.

extension.searchTitle: SUPPORTING AMERICA'S INNOVATORS ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 107

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 4854, amended, to amend the Investment Company Act of 1940 to expand the investor limitation for qualifying venture capital funds under an exemption from the definition of an investment company, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 388 yeas to 9 nays, Roll No. 349;

extension.searchTitle: FIX CROWDFUNDING ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 107

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 4855, amended, to amend provisions in the securities laws relating to regulation crowdfunding to raise the dollar amount limit and to clarify certain requirements and exclusions for funding portals established by such Act, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 394 yeas to 4 nays, Roll No. 350;
